010package imagingbook.common.regions.segment;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
013
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Map;
018
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
022import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
023
024/**
025 * Performs region segmentation on a given binary image.
026 * This class is abstract, since the implementation depends
027 * on the concrete region segmentation algorithm being used.
028 * Concrete implementations (subclasses of this class) are 
029 * {@link BreadthFirstSegmentation},
030 * {@link DepthFirstSegmentation},
031 * {@link RecursiveSegmentation},
032 * {@link SequentialSegmentation},
033 * {@link RegionContourSegmentation}.
034 * 
035 * Practically all work is done by the constructor(s).
036 * If the segmentation has failed for some reason
037 * {@link #getRegions()} returns {@code null}.
038 * 
039 * @version 2021/12/22
040 */
041public abstract class BinaryRegionSegmentation {
042        
043        public static final NeighborhoodType2D DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD = N4;
044        
045        public static final int BACKGROUND = 0;
046        public static final int FOREGROUND = 1;
047        
048        protected ImageProcessor ip = null;
049        protected final int width;
050        protected final int height;     
051        protected final NeighborhoodType2D NT;
052        
053        protected final int[][] labelArray;
054        // label values in labelArray can be:
055        //  0 ... unlabeled
056        // -1 ... previously visited background pixel
057        // >0 ... valid label
058        
059        private final Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regions;
060        private final boolean isSegmented;
061        
062        private final int minLabel = 2;
063        private int currentLabel = -1;  // the maximum label assigned sofar
064        private int maxLabel = -1;              // the maximum label assigned total
065        
066        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        protected BinaryRegionSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
069                this.ip = ip;
070                this.NT = nh;
071                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
072                this.height = ip.getHeight();
073                this.labelArray = makeLabelArray();
074                this.isSegmented = applySegmentation();
075                this.regions = (isSegmented) ? collectRegions() : null;
076                this.ip = null; // release image
077        }
078        
079        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
080                int[][] lA = new int[width][height];    // label array
081                // set all pixels to either FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND (by thresholding)
082                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
083                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
084                                lA[u][v] = (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) ? FOREGROUND : BACKGROUND;
085                        }
086                }
087                return lA;
088        }
089        
090        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
091        
092        /**
093         * This method must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
094         * @return true if successful.
095         */
096        protected abstract boolean applySegmentation();
097        
098        public int getWidth() {
099                return this.width;
100        }
101        
102        public int getHeight() {
103                return this.height;
104        }
105        
106        public int getMinLabel() {
107                return minLabel;
108        }
109        
110        public int getMaxLabel() {
111                return maxLabel;
112        }
113        
114        /**
115         * Returns an unsorted list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
116         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
117         * See also {@link #getRegions(boolean)}.
118         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
119         */
120        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions() {
121                return getRegions(false);       // unsorted
122//              return new ArrayList<>(regions.values());
123        }
124        
125        /**
126         * Returns a (optionally sorted) list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
127         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
128         * @param sort set {@code true} to sort regions by size (largest regions first).
129         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
130         */
131        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions(boolean sort) {
132                if (regions == null) {
133                        throw new RuntimeException("regions is null, this should not happen");
134                }
135
136                BinaryRegion[] ra = regions.values().toArray(new BinaryRegion[0]);
137                if (sort) {
138                        Arrays.sort(ra);
139                }
140                return Arrays.asList(ra);
141        }
142        
143        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
144        
145        /**
146         * Creates a (map) container of {@link BinaryRegion} objects,
147         * collects the region pixels from the label image
148         * and calls {@link SegmentationBackedRegion#update()} to compute
149         * the statistics for each region.
150         * Region label numbers serve as map keys.
151         * @return a map of {@link BinaryRegion} instances.
152         */
153        protected Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> collectRegions() {
154                SegmentationBackedRegion[] regionArray = new SegmentationBackedRegion[maxLabel + 1];
155                for (int label = minLabel; label <= maxLabel; label++) {
156                        regionArray[label] = new SegmentationBackedRegion(label, this);
157                }
158                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
159                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
160                                int label = getLabel(u, v);
161                                if (label >= minLabel && label <= maxLabel && regionArray[label] != null) {
162                                        regionArray[label].addPixel(u, v);
163                                }
164                        }
165                }
166                // create a list of regions to return, collect nonempty regions
167                Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regionMap = new LinkedHashMap<>();
168                for (SegmentationBackedRegion r: regionArray) {
169                        if (r != null && r.getSize() > 0) {
170                                r.update();     // compute the statistics for this region
171                                regionMap.put(r.getLabel(), r); //add(r);
172                        }
173                }
174                return regionMap;
175        }
176        
177        /**
178         * Get the label number for the specified image coordinate.
179         * @param u the horizontal coordinate.
180         * @param v the vertical coordinate.
181         * @return the label number for the given position.
182         */
183        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {
184                return (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height) ? labelArray[u][v] : -1;
185        }
186        
187        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) {
188                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height)
189                        labelArray[u][v] = label;
190        }
191        
192        protected int getNextLabel() {
193                currentLabel = (currentLabel < 1) ? minLabel : currentLabel + 1;
194                maxLabel = currentLabel;
195                return currentLabel;
196        }
197        
198        protected boolean isLabel(int i) {
199                return (i >= minLabel);
200        }
201
202        // --------------------------------------------------
203
204        /**
205         * Finds the region associated to the given label.
206         * @param label the region's label number.
207         * @return the region object associated with the given label
208         *              or {@code null} if it does not exist.
209         */
210        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int label) {
211                return (label < minLabel || label > maxLabel) ? null : regions.get(label);
212        }
213        
214        /**
215         * Finds the {@link BinaryRegion} instance associated with
216         * the given image position.
217         * @param u the horizontal position.
218         * @param v the vertical position.
219         * @return The associated {@link BinaryRegion} object or null if
220         *              this {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} has no region at the given position.
221         */
222        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int u, int v) {
223                return getRegion(getLabel(u, v));
224        }
225
226}
